@graph.caption: Tostada shells topped with refried beans, seasoned ground beef, lettuce, avocado, pico de gallo and sour cream.

@graph.name: Easy Homemade Tostadas - Tastes Better from Scratch
@graph.description: The BEST and easiest Tostada recipe made with meat (beef, chicken, or pork), refried beans, cheese, and other toppings all on crispy tostada.

@graph.name: Lauren Allen
@graph.description: Welcome! I’m Lauren, a mom of four and lover of good food. Here you’ll find easy recipes and weeknight meal ideas made with real ingredients, with step-by-step photos and videos.

@graph.name: Easy Mexican Tostada
@graph.description: A simple homemade Tostada recipe made with meat (beef, chicken, or pork), refried beans, cheese, and other toppings all on crispy tostada shell.

video.name: Tostadas
video.description: One of my go-to dinners when I need something QUICK and easy is homemade Tostadas made with ground beef (or shredded chicken or pork), refried beans, and cheese. They’re so fresh and tasty and a meal that everyone gets excited for.

recipeIngredient: 10  tostada shells  ((or regular corn tortillas, if making your own tostada shell))
1 lb ground beef (,( or substitute cooked shredded chicken, pork or beef))
¼ teaspoon EACH garlic powder, oregano, black pepper
Salsa (, pico de gallo or salsa verde)

recipeInstructions.text: Bake or Fry the corn tortillas, if not using store bought tostada shells.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake or Fry the corn tortillas, if not using store bought tostada shells.

recipeInstructions.text: Add ground beef to a skillet over medium heat. Cook, breaking into small pieces with a wooden spoon, until browned. Remove grease.
recipeInstructions.name: Add ground beef to a skillet over medium heat. Cook, breaking into small pieces with a wooden spoon, until browned. Remove grease.

recipeInstructions.text: Add onion and seasonings and cook an additional few minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add onion and seasonings and cook an additional few minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the refried beans to a microwave safe bowl, or a small skillet over medium heat. Stir in a small scoop of sour cream. Cook until warmed through.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the refried beans to a microwave safe bowl, or a small skillet over medium heat. Stir in a small scoop of sour cream. Cook until warmed through.

recipeInstructions.text: Assemble the tostadas: Spread a thin layer of refried beans over the tostada shell. Top with a small spoonful of ground beef, then lettuce, cheese, avocado, salsa, sour cream and hot sauce.
recipeInstructions.name: Assemble the tostadas: Spread a thin layer of refried beans over the tostada shell. Top with a small spoonful of ground beef, then lettuce, cheese, avocado, salsa, sour cream and hot sauce.

@graph.keywords: homemade tostada, mexican tostada, tostada, tostadas
